comment: PhotovoltaicDevice schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.GreenEnergy/master/PhotovoltaicDevice/schema.json
description: The Data Model is intended to describe the mechanical, electrical and thermal characteristics of photo-voltaic panels according to *STC - Standard Test Condition* and *NOCT - Normal Operating Cell Temperature*. *Remark* : This Data Model can be used directly as a main entity to describe the `Photovoltaic Device`  or as a sub-entity of the Data Model  `DEVICE` using a reference by the `refDevice` attribute. The measures performed for STC and NOCT are `Pmax` (Maximum Nominal Power), `Umpp` (Optimal operating

contents.name: MaximumSystemVoltage
contents.comment: Maximum system voltage permitted for the **module**. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **VLT** represents Volt

contents.name: NominalPower
contents.comment: Nominal Power for the **panel**. This is the same value of items [Pmax] for [moduleSTC] attribute. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **WTT** represents Watt

contents.name: PanelNbModules
contents.comment: Number of 'Modules' per 'Panel'

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: areaWeight
contents.comment: Area Weight measured in Kg/m². The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **28** represents Kilogram per square meter

contents.name: brandName
contents.comment: Brand Name of the item

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateLastReported
contents.comment: A timestamps which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data. Date and time in an ISO8601 UTCformat.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: documentation
contents.comment: Technical Documentation (Installation / maintenance / used)

contents.name: manufacturerName
contents.comment: Manufacturer Name of the item

contents.name: modelName
contents.comment: Model Name of the item

contents.name: moduleNbCells
contents.comment: Number of 'cells' per 'module'

contents.name: moduleYieldRate
contents.comment: Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system. A unique value

contents.name: nTCClass
contents.comment: The Negative Temperature Coefficient of resistance - *NTC*, describes the relative change of a physical property that is associated with a given change in negative temperature. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **P1** represents Percent

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: pTCClass
contents.comment: The Positive Temperature Coefficient of resistance - *PTC*, describes the relative change of a physical property that is associated with a given change in positive temperature. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **P1** represents Percent.

contents.name: panelLifetime
contents.comment: Average lifetime of a panel. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **ANN** represents Year

contents.name: panelWeight
contents.comment: Weight of a panel (Sometime the reference used is Kg / m²). The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **KGM** represents Kilogram

contents.name: performanceLowIrradiance
contents.comment: Average relative yield to Performance at Low Irradiance. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **P1** represents Percent

contents.name: protectionIP
contents.comment: IP 'Ingress Protection' for the Junction Box. This is the level classifies and rates the degree of protection provided by mechanical casings and electrical enclosures against intrusion, dust, accidental contact, and water according to International Electrotechnical Commission standard (EN 60-529). First digit: Solid particle protection (Single numeral: 0–6 or 'X'). Second digit: Liquid ingress protection (Single numeral: 0–9 or 'X' ).Third digit: Personal Protection  against access to dangerous parts (optio

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: application
contents.comment: Target application regarding the Type of Solar panel (In our case `electric`). A unique value. https://schema.org/Text. Enum:'electric, thermal, other'

contents.name: applicationClass
contents.comment: Evaluation of the potential hazards associated with the module. A unique value. Enum:'A, B, C'

contents.name: cellType
contents.comment: Type of cells used to built the photo-voltaic unit. 2 kinds of Technologies *`Cristalline`* or  *`Thin layers`*. A unique value. Enum:'amorphousSilicon, CfTe, CIS, monocrystalline, polycrystalline, other'

contents.name: fireClass
contents.comment: Evaluation to the fire (IEC 61730). A unique value. Enum:'A, B, C'

contents.name: installationCondition
contents.comment: Condition and possibility of use in the following environments. A combination. Enum:'desert, dust, extremeHeat, extremeCold, extremeClimate, extremeHumidity, marine, none, other, saline, sand, seismic'

contents.name: installationMode
contents.comment: Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system. A unique value. Enum:'ground, other, pole, roofing, wall'

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: panelYieldCurve
contents.comment: Option 1. Energy production yield curve of the panel from its [NominalPower] at [T0] and along its [panelLifetime]. The Measurements provided in the list are a sequence of Energy Production Capacity represented in Percent starting at 5 years with a 'Step' of 5 years according to the information provided by the manufacturer. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **P1** represents Percent.

contents.name: possibilityOfUse
contents.comment: Possibility of use. A unique value. Enum:'mixed, mobile, other, stationary'

contents.name: serialNumber
contents.comment: List of serial numbers of Photo-voltaic device supplied by the manufacturer and assembled in operating mode on a single location

contents.name: typeOfUse
contents.comment: Accepted use regarding its positioning in an indoor / outdoor environment. A unique value. Enum:'indoor, outdoor, mixed, other'

contents.name: MaxPressureLoad
contents.comment: aximum mechanics Pressure (shear, elasticity, compression) load on a Panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **PAL** represents Pascal

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address

contents.name: cellDimension
contents.comment: External dimension of a cell. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **MMT** represents Millimeter.

contents.name: cellOperatingTemperature
contents.comment: This is the nominal operating temperature range of the cells in which it collects solar energy. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CEL** represents Degree Celsius

contents.name: moduleDimension
contents.comment: External dimension of a module. A module can be an assembly of 1 to n cells. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **MMT** represents Millimeter

contents.name: moduleNOCT
contents.comment: Normal Operating Cell Temperature measurements. The format is structured by a sub-property of 5 items. Pmax in Watt. Umpp in Volt. Impp in Ampere. Uoc in Volt. Isc in Ampere

contents.name: moduleSTC
contents.comment: Standard Test Condition measurements. The format is structured by a sub-property of 5 items. Pmax in Watt. Umpp in Volt. Impp in Ampere. Uoc in Volt. Isc in Ampere

contents.name: panelDimension
contents.comment: External dimension of a Panel. A solar panel can be an assembly of 1 to n modules, which themselves are made of several cells which collect heat from the sun's rays. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **MMT** represents Millimeter.

contents.name: panelOperatingTemperature
contents.comment: Ambient operating temperature range. This is the minimum and maximum resistance to cold and heat for using the panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CEL** represents Degree Celsius

contents.name: temperatureCoefficient
contents.comment: Temperature influence coefficient on the panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. Pmax in Watt. Uoc in Volt. Isc in Ampere
